intro: Pedicularis fastigiata, commonly known as the upright monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
